msItem.title: Prologue
msItem.incipit: Non idem ordo est duodecim prophetarum
Materia Osee triplex est. Loquitur enim secundum historiam
Ordo prophetarum secundum LXX talis est

msItem.title: Prol.
msItem.note: Written in the main text column, no gloss. Rest of fol. 4r blank.

msItem.title: Hosea
msItem.incipit: Hoc est et est quasi titulus libri
Hier. Ozias qui et Azarias regnauit in Ierusalem

msItem.title: Joel
msItem.note: Prologues (Stegmüller, Bibl. 511, 510) given as the first items of the gloss, occupying the upper part of fol. 29r in two columns.
msItem.incipit: domini patris factum non quantum ad se
Jer. Fatuel propheta pater Ioel propheta a LXX

msItem.title: Amos
msItem.note: Prologues (Stegmüller, Bibl. 515, 512, 513) given as the first items of the gloss.
msItem.incipit: Amos non ad Ierusalem sed ad Israel in Samaria prophetat

msItem.title: Abdias
msItem.note: Prologue (Stegmüller, Bibl. 519) given as the first item of the gloss, occupying two columns of the top area of the fol. 59v.
msItem.incipit: Abdias quanto breuior tanto est profundior

msItem.title: Jonas
msItem.note: Prologue (Stegmüller, Bibl. 524) given as the first item of the gloss, occupying both columns of the top area of fol. 63r.

msItem.title: Micah
msItem.note: Prologue (Stegmüller, Bibl. 524) given as the first item of the gloss, occupying both columns of the top area of fol. 69v.
msItem.incipit: Micheas secundum Hebraicam ueritatem sextus est

msItem.title: Nahum
msItem.note: Prologue (Stegmüller, Bibl. 528) presented as the first item of the gloss, occupying both columns of the lower area of fol. 83v.
msItem.incipit: Cum Ionas at Naum de eadem

msItem.title: Habakkuk
msItem.note: Prologue (Stegmüller, Bibl. 531) presented as the first item of the gloss, occupying both columns of fol. 90r and the first line lines of the outer column of fol. 90v.
msItem.incipit: Conmentatur Ieronimus super Oseę, Ioel, et Amos

msItem.title: Zephaniah
msItem.note: The first part of the prologue (Stegmüller, Bibl. 534, ending at 'non est exaltatum cor meum') presented as the first item of the gloss, occupying both columns of the lower area of fol. 97v, followed by 'Explicit prologus ...'; the second part of the prologue occupying a single column of gloss in the upper part of fol. 98r.
msItem.incipit: In titulo generatio prophete et tempus notatur

msItem.title: Haggai
msItem.note: Fol. 105v contains the prologue (Stegmüller, Bibl. 538) presented in two columns.
The main text breaking off at 'Et ponam'; the final words (from 'te quasi signaculum...') supplied in the outer gloss column of fol. 110v.
msItem.incipit: Cum Cyrus rex Persarum occiso Balthasar

msItem.title: Zechariah
msItem.note: Prologue (Stegmüller, Bibl. 539) presented as the first item of the gloss, occupying the upper part of fol. 111r in two columns.

msItem.title: Malachi
msItem.note: Prologue (Stegmüller, Bibl. 543) presented as the first item of the gloss, occupying the upper part of fol. 137v in two columns.

supportDesc.collation: 1(8)–13(8), 14(8+1) (fol. 105 added at the beginning of the quire) (fols. 1–104, 105–113) | 15(8)–18(8) (fols. 114–144). Quires numbered in Roman on the bottom centre of the final verso. Later medieval leaf signatures in the upper margin.
supportDesc.condition: Damaged and stained by water, with the text faded and difficult to read in places.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in plummet. The main text in one central column of 15 widely spaced lines, with double horizontal bounding lines, ruled space 150 47

Separate ruling for up to 38 lines of gloss, typically in the outer and inner columns but often extending into the upper and lower margins to form a 'textus inclusus' with two columns at the top and bottom of the page; prologues often written in this two-column format. Width of the inner column c. 30 mm., of the outer column c. 55 mm., the overall width of the written area c. 140–5 mm.
Gloss and text both written above top line.

handDesc.handNote: Protogothic book and gloss script. The main text perhaps in two hands, changing at fol. 127v. Marginal and interlinear gloss mostly by one other hand, but with marginal gloss by two other hands in quire 15 (fols. 114–121) and quire 16 (fols. 122–129)

decoDesc.decoNote: Spaces left for initials, not filled in.

binding.p: Laudian binding of calf over pasteboards, stamped with Laud's arms in gilt.

history.provenance: Lorsch, Benedictine abbey (?). Nigel F. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher: die mittelalterliche Bibliotheksgeschichte von Kloster Eberbach im Rheingau (Regensburg, 1998), pp. 236, 284, asserted a Lorsch provenance, citing Bischoff, who was more cautious (Die Abtei Lorsch... (1989), pp. 110–1); there is no evidence except what can be inferred from the history of the manuscript at Eberbach, for which see below.

Eberbach, Cistercian abbey: no ex libris, but probably identifiable as D2 (part 1) in the catalogue of 1502: Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher, p. 234; part 2 of catalogue D2 was MS. Laud Lat. 104, also probably from Lorsch. The added late medieval leaf signatures, as pointed out by Nicholson (Summary Catalogue II.i.46) appear to be by the same hand as those in MS. Laud Misc. 417 and MS. Laud Misc. 452 pt. 2; both manuscripts came to Eberbach from Lorsch. Characteristic Eberbach annotations (Quarto Catalogue, p. xxv).
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, given in 1639. Former Bodleian shelfmark F. 32.

recordHist.source:
Description by Matthew Holford, July 2021. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 14
Summary Catalogue, Vol. 2, part 1, p. 46

bibl.note: (full facsimile, with manucript description by Michael Kautz, 2014)

revisionDesc.change: James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
